reviewText: I used to watch the syndicated Rocky & Bullwinkle shows and loved the Fractured Fairy Tales, which was my favorite part of the show. The collection here includes a great selection of tales read by the wonderful Edward Everett Horton. His wonderful voice overs helped make the show. While kids may enjoy it, I think adults would enjoy them more for the clever jabs at life that are still funny. These cartoons were part of the rare animation that may have been marketed for kids, but was enjoyed more by adults. They don't make them like this anymore. You do have to sit through some annoying kid previews, but the cartoons are worth it! A must have for your collection.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: Slightly cynical but very humorous take on the fairy tales of old... This is especially true of the closing 'moral' to the story
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: I love the old comics.  Looney tunes, Rocky and Bullwinkle.  This is a great addition to anyones collect of old comics.  I used to wake up at 5 AM every Saturday morning when I was a kid to watch these old comics.  I am glad now I can watch them when I want and relive my childhood!!
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: I remembered seeing these as a kid and I think we liked them, but trying to watch now with my kids just seems like it's drivel...and they don't need any more of that.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: I love these little stories. The cartoon artistry is excellent and unique. Why don't they make them like this now.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: Hilariously funny.  Glad this finally came out on DVD.  Brings back fond memories of Saturday mornings.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: I almost threw the DVD out it had some sort of kids advertisement, as if this collection had anything to do with brood. Someone doing the packaging evidently did not view the product.  Wait there is more you can not fast forward; you can not go to the main menu; your and not pause. You just can not do anything but turn the sound off on the set and go to the fridge while waiting.If you are lucking and have a DVD riper and copier you can fix the problem.Once you finally get to view the disk it is worth your time. The 15 fairy tails are in blocs of five. Finally you get the fairy tale as it was meant to be unabridged and unvarnished.Rapunzel- The Brave Little Tailor- Rumpelstiltskin- Cinderella- Snow White- Sleeping Beauty- Pinocchio- Ridinghoods Anonymous- The Ugly Duckling- Cinderella Returns- Rumpelstiltskin Returns- Leaping Beauty- The Enchanted Frog- The Pied Piper- The Magic FishAn added plus id the narration by Edward Everett Horton. You may remember him from "Lost Horizon" (1837)I leave you with this though "stay wood"- Gephetto.
summary: Edward Everett Horton is the perfect narrator
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: I loved these growing up and now my daughter and I watch them together. They show their age a bit but they are still very entertaining.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: When I was young I thought this show was really funny but now it just seems silly. The plots make no sense even for spoofs. Example: One story is about A commoner who becomes a war hero because he carries around a rotten fish that causes the enemy to surrender just to be rid of him. Some may find it funny but it's not for me.
summary: Not as Funny as I remember
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: Say what you will about Jay Ward's cartoons, but it's all been said before. Yes, the animation wasn't the greatest, but to me they were just plain funny. I appreciate them more as an adult than I did as a child because I understand the jokes which makes them funnier. I loved them as a child and I still love them. So go ahead and just laugh, laugh, laugh. You'll feel so much better.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: I like to watch this because it puts a funny spin on fairy tales. It reminds me of when I was a child. Good to watch after a crazy day,
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: This show is just like I remember it and was very cute.  You get 3 cartoons per episode.  Very funny.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: It is always fun to watch cartoons from the past. Love the oldies, can't wait to watch more of these great cartoons.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: I laughed and laughed at these re-telling of fairy tales I've known all my life. Edward Everett Horton did a great job of narrating these stories. This is pure recreation.
summary: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: If you're reading this, you know the Jay Ward's Fractured Fairy Tales are terrific and funny.  Unfortunately, this compilation disk is flawed.  The VERY irritating menu demands that you sit through too horrible trailers for terrible kid's movies before you can get to the main menu.  They won't even fast forward or skip to main menu.  Why would Sony insist on this very Disney-like irritation.  What would Jay Ward think?  This disk is for collector's, not brain-dead children who want to watch "Frosty the Sequel".  The disk also has menu problems once you get to the main menu.  I've contacted Sony and hopefully they will fix the problem.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: Takes me back in the days when I used to watch as a kid. Still entertaining...still enjoy it. Introducing my grandkids to it.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: I loved this cartoon so much as a child, and now that I am reliving some old stuff from my childhood I love it just as much....so I had to have this dvd in my collection.....always loved the shorts from Rocky and Bullwinkle so much more than the actual show.....worth every penny....
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: Such wit and cleverness is sadly lacking in today's television.  If this doesn't make you smile, I don't know what would.  I only wish there were more to watch.  50 years old and still great?  Wow.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: I loved every minuet of it and so did my nieces and nephew. these kids have no idea what cartoons were really like. Classic Television.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: Must see to relax.  I really enjoy watching to unwind.  Watching the old type of cartoons are very relaxing and enjoyable.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: Such a different perspective watching as an adult!  I bought this for my 4 & 6 year old girls, and watching it with them is really fun.  They get some of the quirky because they know the fairy tales, but some of the innuendo is lost on them - for now at least!  Funny thing is I heard them playing the other day and talking about "the contract" which is a reoccurring theme.  They don't miss much!  Of the 3 I ordered - Tennessee Tuxedo, Peabody & Sherman and Fractured Fairy Tales, I'd have to say this is the favourite at the moment.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: We read the original stories in all episodes, and really enjoyed seeing how they were fractured!  Wish there were more programminglike this being produced today.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: Many of these were taken from the later "Bullwinkle Show" and are not as funny as their earlier versions, but it's fun to enjoy all the parodies and caricatures that we missed when we were kids. The best part is of course, Edward Everett Horton as narrator. Always loved the sound of his voice, and the fact that he narrates so seriously makes these episodes even funnier. Take a romp through a fairyland from the "other side".
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: A cool little trip down memory lane. I remember seeing these during the Rocky n Bullwinkle show as a kid so bought them for nostalgic reasons.  They are not as funny or entertaining as I remember... but still a cool little piece for my cartoon collection.  If you have little ones... they would probably get a kick out of them too.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: I bought this for my grand kids, so when they visit we can watch decent cartoons and laugh together. I hate these modern cartoons of today; they suck
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: Fractured Fairy Tales is an excellent and timely revision of time-worn fairy tales. No one is too old for Fractured Fairy Tales. The droll stories are entertaining for the whole family.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: These are 5-star television comedy cartoons (not great animation, just great comedy).  HOWEVER, if you already own the Rocky & Bullwinkle season sets you already have these. The number is the Fractured Fairy Tale sequence number, not the aired episode number.From Rocky & Bullwinkle Season 13) Rapunzel6) The Brave Little Tailor7) Rumpelstiltskin14) Cinderella15) Snow White18) Pinocchio22) Cinderella ReturnsFrom Rocky & Bullwinkle Season 219) Ridinghoods Anonymous20) Sleeping Beauty36) The Ugly Duckling31) Rumpelstiltskin Returns27) Leaping Beauty40) The Enchanted Frog25) The Pied Piper32) The Magic FishOrder seasons 1 & 2 here:Rocky & Bullwinkle & Friends - The Complete First SeasonRocky & Bullwinkle & Friends - The Complete Second Season
summary: Great cartoon comedy, but just re-issues of seasons 1 & 2
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: My daughters loved the inventive stories that come from this series.The charters from these stories are very colorful. I highly recommend this cartoon to your viewers.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: Just like I remember seeing it when I was a kid. Good for all ages and worth the price.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: I just received this DVD from Amazon and watched it right away.  I don't know what other reviewers are saying about the previews on this disc.  I just fast-forwarded to the menu and skipped the commercials, no problem.  I like that you can choose to play one specific cartoon or select to play all.The cartoons are just like I remember them, including the intro and ending to each one.  I really enjoyed going back in time with one of the main reasons I watched Rocky & Bullwinkle at all.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: This is just great plane simple comedy. Life is to complicated and serious. Sit back and enjoy something silly. Enough said!
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: The packaging was in excellent condition.  The DVD plays perfect.  The cartoons were the exact quality as when I was a young child.  I love them and I was able to share them with my nine year old.  1000 % BETTER than now day cartoons!
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: I downloaded supposedly for my grand children ( but also for myself ).  I was wonderful hearing Edward Everett Horton's voice again narrating these updated ( to the early 1960s ) fairy tales.
summary: Has not lost anything over time!
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: I enjoyed these clips on Bullwinkle as a child and now my children enjoy them as well.  They are clever and funny without the cheap gross humor overwhelming kids' TV shows today.  The Fairy Tales are narrated by the wonderful Edward Everett Horton, and while the animation is obviously dated, these shorts are really a absolute treasure.
summary: Fond Memories now enjoyed by my kids
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: Always loved these "tales" as a kid.  Watched them again at age 50 with niece, who is 9, she loved them as much as I did.  Wants her own copy for B'day.  Who says kids these days have no taste.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: Brings back fond memories... Great for the children to see what old cartoons daddy used to watch when he was a child.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One

reviewText: Everything is distastefully insane. Not funny, illogical, and no point at all. Just stupid. I don't think Forrest Gump would like it either.
Title: The Best of Fractured Fairy Tales, Volume One
